meanings.definition: Relating to vocal features such as tone, pitch, and volume that convey meaning beyond the actual words spoken.
meanings.sent1: Her paralinguistic cues, like the way she raised her voice at the end of the sentence, revealed her excitement.
meanings.sent2: The paralinguistic elements of his speech, such as the soft tone he used, made his message more engaging.
meanings.sent3: When he tried to whisper loudly, his paralinguistic attempt at secrecy was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The paralinguistic dance of tones in her voice painted a vivid picture of her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The paralinguistic nuances in his speech were as clear as a bright, sunny day.

meanings.definition: Nonverbal communication through gestures, facial expressions, and body language.
meanings.sent1: Her paralinguistic gestures, like the way she waved her hands, added depth to her storytelling.
meanings.sent2: Effective communication involves not only words but also paralinguistic cues like facial expressions.
meanings.sent3: His paralinguistic dance moves on the dance floor were both entertaining and expressive.
meanings.sent4: The paralinguistic symphony of expressions on her face spoke louder than words.
meanings.sent5: The paralinguistic art of body language can convey emotions without saying a single word.
